lessons.title: 1. Incident Response Fundamentals
lessons.description: Learn about incident response procedures and crisis management

pages.title: What is Incident Response?
pages.content: Incident response is a systematic approach to handling and managing security incidents. It involves preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery phases.

pages.title: Incident Response Lifecycle
pages.content: The incident response lifecycle includes preparation, identification, containment, eradication, recovery, and lessons learned. Each phase is crucial for effective incident handling.

pages.title: Incident Response Team
pages.content: An effective incident response team includes incident managers, security analysts, forensic specialists, communications specialists, and legal advisors. Each role has specific responsibilities.

pages.title: Digital Forensics
pages.content: Digital forensics involves collecting, preserving, and analyzing digital evidence. It's essential for understanding what happened during a security incident and supporting legal proceedings.

pages.title: Crisis Communication
pages.content: Effective crisis communication is crucial during security incidents. It involves internal communication, external communication, stakeholder management, and reputation protection.

pages.title: Quiz: Incident Response
pages.question: What is the first phase of the incident response lifecycle?
pages.explanation: Preparation is the first phase of the incident response lifecycle, involving planning, training, and setting up necessary tools and procedures.
